column18: 10% to 100% tuition fee waiver based on merit and need
column20: Session 1 deadline; Session 2 available till May
column23: Must qualify BITSAT exam; Different waivers for different score ranges (300+ = 75%, 250-299 = 50%, 200-249 = 25%)
column26: BITSAT Scorecard,12th Marksheet,Aadhar Card,Income Certificate (for merit-cum-need),Admission Proof
column28: BITS Pilani offers comprehensive merit-based scholarships ranging from 10% to 100% tuition fee waiver for students admitted through BITSAT. Scholarships are awarded based on BITSAT scores, board exam performance, and financial need. Top scorers (300+) can receive up to 75% fee waiver, while merit-cum-need scholarships can cover 100% tuition for deserving students.
column29: Tuition fee waiver (10-100%), Hostel fee concession (25% for BITSAT 150+), Renewable based on CGPA, Special scholarships for board toppers and sports achievers
column30: 1. Register for BITSAT 2026 on official portal 2. Appear for BITSAT exam (Session 1: April 15-17 or Session 2: May 24-26) 3. Qualify exam and apply for admission 4. Merit scholarships auto-awarded based on score 5. For merit-cum-need, submit income documents during admission 6. Scholarship reflected in fee structure
column31: Merit-based on BITSAT score and 12th marks; Merit-cum-need considers financial background; Top 5% under merit-cum-need get 100% waiver; Renewable semester-wise based on CGPA (9.0+ for 20% waiver)
column32: [{"q":"Do I need to apply separately for scholarship?","a":"No, merit scholarships are auto-awarded based on BITSAT score. Only merit-cum-need requires additional documentation."},{"q":"What BITSAT score is needed for scholarship?","a":"200+ for 25% waiver, 250+ for 50% waiver, 300+ for 75% waiver"},{"q":"Is the scholarship renewable?","a":"Yes, renewable semester-wise based on maintaining required CGPA"}]
column43: Renewable semester-wise based on CGPA; Must maintain 9.0 CGPA for 20% merit scholarship
column46: Very popular scholarship; 100 Girls Scholarship also available for top female candidates from low-income families

column12: All (Special scholarship for girl child available)
column18: ₹15,000-40,000 based on course (Medical: ₹40,000, Engineering: ₹30,000, General/Diploma: ₹20,000, Girl Child: ₹15,000)
column20: Typically opens in September; Check official website for exact dates
column23: Not for postgraduate studies; Students receiving other scholarships ineligible; Preference to lower income bands
column26: Income Certificate,Caste Certificate (if applicable),Bank Account Details,Cancelled Cheque,Marksheet of last qualifying exam,Aadhar Card
column28: LIC Golden Jubilee Scholarship Scheme provides financial assistance to meritorious students from economically weaker sections pursuing higher education. The scholarship supports students in Medical, Engineering, General Graduation, Diploma, and ITI courses with amounts ranging from ₹15,000 to ₹40,000 annually based on the course type.
column29: Annual scholarship of ₹15,000-40,000 paid in two installments; Direct bank transfer via NEFT; Special scholarship for girl child (₹15,000 for 2 years); Covers tuition fees and educational expenses
column30: 1. Visit www.licindia.in or scholarship portal 2. Click 'Apply Now' for Golden Jubilee Scholarship 3. Register using email/mobile 4. Fill application form with personal, academic, income details 5. Upload required documents (income cert, marksheet, bank details) 6. Review and submit application 7. Receive acknowledgment with application number 8. Shortlisted candidates contacted by Divisional Offices
column31: Merit-based considering marks obtained and income criteria; Lower income bands given preference; Shortlisted candidates evaluated by Divisional Offices; Physical document verification required
column32: [{"q":"What is the income limit?","a":"Annual family income must not exceed ₹4.5 lakh from all sources"},{"q":"Can postgraduate students apply?","a":"No, this scholarship is only for undergraduate, diploma, and ITI courses"},{"q":"How is the scholarship amount paid?","a":"Paid in two equal installments directly to student's bank account via NEFT"}]
column43: For general scholarship: Must maintain 55% in Medical/Engineering or 50% in General courses; Girl child scholarship is for 2 years only
column46: Special focus on girl child education; Two categories - General and Special for Girl Child

column8: All streams (Class 11-12, General Graduation, Professional Degree, Diploma, ITI)
column18: ₹10,000-1,00,000 based on marks and course (Professional: up to ₹1L, General UG: ₹12-18K, Class 11-12: ₹10-15K)
column20: Applications typically open in September annually
column23: Children of Tata Capital and Buddy4Study employees not eligible; Professional degree requires 80% marks; Selection based on academic excellence and financial background
column26: Aadhaar Card,Passport-size photo,Income Proof (Form 16A/Income Certificate/Salary slips),Admission Proof (ID card/Bonafide),Fee Receipt,Bank Account Details,Cancelled Cheque,Marksheets,Disability Certificate (if applicable),Caste Certificate (if applicable)
column28: Tata Capital Pankh Scholarship Program supports meritorious students from economically weaker sections to pursue higher education. The scholarship covers up to 80% of tuition fees with amounts ranging from ₹10,000 for Class 11-12 students to ₹1,00,000 for professional degree programs, based on academic performance and financial need.
column29: Up to 80% of tuition/course fees; Class 11-12: ₹10-15K, General UG/Diploma: ₹12-18K, Professional degrees: up to ₹1 lakh; One-time grant for academic year; Direct bank transfer
column30: 1. Visit Buddy4Study platform 2. Click 'Apply Now' for Tata Pankh Scholarship 3. Login or register with email/mobile/Gmail 4. Click 'Start Application' 5. Fill 'Check Your Eligibility' form 6. Complete application with accurate details 7. Upload all required documents 8. Accept Terms and Conditions, click 'Preview' 9. Review all details carefully 10. Submit application
column31: Merit-cum-need based; Academic excellence (60-80% marks) and financial background considered; Higher marks get higher scholarship amounts; One-time grant for the academic year
column32: [{"q":"What is the income limit?","a":"Annual family income must be less than ₹2.5 lakh from all sources"},{"q":"How much scholarship can I get?","a":"Depends on your marks and course: 60-80% get lower amount, 91%+ get maximum; Professional degrees get up to ₹1 lakh"},{"q":"Is it renewable?","a":"No, it's a one-time grant for the academic year. You need to reapply next year"}]
column43: One-time grant; Need to reapply annually
column46: Managed through Buddy4Study platform; Good for students across all education levels

column3: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India
column20: Applications typically open June-August; Check NSP portal for exact dates
column23: Only for OBC, EBC, and DNT categories; Cannot hold any other educational scholarship simultaneously; Must score 60% in previous class
column26: Aadhaar Card,Category Certificate (OBC/EBC/DNT),Income Certificate,Previous year marksheet,School Bonafide Certificate,Bank Account Details,Passport-size photo
column28: PM Yashasvi (Vibrant India) Scholarship is a Central Government scheme providing financial assistance to meritorious students from OBC, EBC, and DNT categories studying in Class 9 and Class 11. The scholarship offers ₹75,000 annually for Class 9 students and ₹1,25,000 for Class 11 students to support their education in government or recognized private schools.
column29: Class 9: ₹75,000 per year; Class 11: ₹1,25,000 per year; Covers tuition, books, and educational expenses; Direct bank transfer; Separate Pre-Matric scheme also available (₹4,000/year for Classes 9-10 in govt schools)
column30: 1. Visit National Scholarship Portal (scholarships.gov.in) 2. Register/Login with credentials 3. Select PM Yashasvi Scholarship scheme 4. Fill application form with personal and academic details 5. Upload required documents (category cert, income cert, marksheet) 6. Enter bank account details 7. Review application carefully 8. Submit application 9. Note down application ID for tracking
column31: Merit-based selection considering 60% minimum marks in previous class; Priority to students from OBC, EBC, and DNT categories; Income limit strictly enforced (below ₹2.5 lakh); Verification by concerned authorities
column32: [{"q":"Who can apply?","a":"Students from OBC, EBC, or DNT categories currently in Class 9 or 11 with family income below ₹2.5 lakh"},{"q":"Can I apply if I'm in a private school?","a":"Yes, students in government, government-aided, or recognized private schools can apply"},{"q":"Can I get this with another scholarship?","a":"No, you cannot hold any other educational scholarship simultaneously with PM Yashasvi"}]
column43: Renewable annually subject to maintaining eligibility criteria and academic performance
column46: Major central government initiative for OBC/EBC/DNT students; High scholarship amount

column3: Tribal Research and Training Institute, Pune
column8: All streams (School, College, Professional, Vocational, Ph.D.)
column15: Varies by scheme (some schemes have no income limit)
column18: Amount varies by scheme - from school scholarships to Ph.D. fellowships
column20: Different schemes have different deadlines; Research Fellowship typically Jan-Mar; Competitive exam coaching Aug-Sep
column23: Only for Scheduled Tribe (ST) category; Caste Validity Certificate mandatory; Maharashtra domicile required; Repeaters generally not eligible for same standard
column26: Aadhaar Card (front and back),ST Caste Certificate,Caste Validity Certificate (mandatory),Domicile Certificate,Income Certificate (last 3 years by Tahsildar),Previous year marksheet,10th/SSC certificate,12th/HSC certificate,Graduation/PG certificates (if applicable),Bank account details,Passport-size photo,Scanned signature,Non-Creamy Layer Certificate (if applicable),PWD certificate (if applicable)
column28: Tribal Research and Training Institute (TRTI), Pune offers various scholarships and training programs exclusively for Scheduled Tribe (ST) students from Maharashtra. The schemes cover education from school level to Ph.D., including competitive exam coaching, pre-examination training, and research fellowships to support tribal students' educational advancement.
column29: Multiple schemes available: School/college scholarships, Professional course support, Competitive exam coaching (SSC, IBPS, MPSC, TET, Police, Military), Ph.D. Research Fellowship, Pre-examination training programs; Amounts vary by scheme
column30: 1. Visit trti.maharashtra.gov.in 2. New users: Register with mobile and email, receive OTP, submit registration 3. Login with credentials (change password after first login) 4. Fill application form (personal, address, qualification details) 5. Upload scanned documents in specified formats (JPG for photo/signature, PDF for others) 6. Select appropriate scheme from eligible list 7. Submit application (no edits allowed after submission) 8. Download/print application for records 9. Check status using Application ID or mobile number
column31: Varies by scheme; Generally merit-based for academic scholarships; Eligibility verification by TRTI; Caste Validity Certificate mandatory; Income criteria for some schemes; Selection for competitive exam coaching based on graduation status
column32: [{"q":"Who can apply?","a":"Only ST category students with Maharashtra domicile and valid Caste Validity Certificate"},{"q":"What is Caste Validity Certificate?","a":"A mandatory certificate issued by competent authority validating your ST caste claim, required specifically for TRTI schemes"},{"q":"Can I apply for multiple schemes?","a":"Yes, if you meet eligibility for multiple schemes, you can apply separately for each"}]
column43: Varies by scheme; Some renewable, some one-time
column46: Maharashtra-specific; Multiple schemes under TRTI umbrella; Caste Validity Certificate is unique requirement
